title: Recomendations for visiting Zurich
content:
I will be in Zurich for 2 weeks this coming Sunday and I was wondering if anyone here had any recommendations? Good book shops (1st/2nd/antique, anything) or any good galleries, just anything you think is good and worth seeing.

Thanks a lot,

TL
author: vigeoh

comments.content:
Two weeks? Well, one thing you could do is visit Geneva, which I personally prefer.

hhp

If you’re interested in poster graphics, you should check out the Plakatsammlung (Poster Collection), although it seems they are in limited service these days.  
 [http://www.museum-gestaltung.ch/en/collections/poster/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.museum-gestaltung.ch/en/collections/poster/ "http://www.museum-gestaltung.ch/en/collections/poster/")

There are some great museums and galleries in Zurich (and even more in Basel, which is an hour away).  
If you want some printing/type/book-historical background I highly recommend the Swiss museum of paper, type and printing, which is in Basel: [http://www.papiermuseum.ch/en/the-museum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.papiermuseum.ch/en/the-museum/ "http://www.papiermuseum.ch/en/the-museum/")

Nina, is that museum with all the incredible medieval arms and armor in Zurich or Geneva? It's been so many years, I forget. It's my favorite museum in the world.

hhp
Wha? That sounds cool, and I have no idea. Was it a historical museum?

Hrant, do you mean the [Arms & Militeria Collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.nationalmuseum.ch/e/sammlung/wissenschaft_und_sammlungen/militaria_waffen.php) at the National Museum?

I enjoyed Zurich a great deal but visiting with my father we spent a great deal of time in places he had hung out in when he lived there aged 18-20, which is to say we sampled a great deal of beer and food. I did manage to get him over to the [Design Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.museum-gestaltung.ch/), which was cool and does have at least [one typographic exhibition](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.museum-gestaltung.ch/en/exhibitions/annual-program-2014/weingart-typography/) coming up.

Karl, that sounds like it! It was super impressive (and free). I remember getting my wife to take a picture of me grasping a halberd, and 5 seconds later the security guy showed up...

hhp

**Bookstores:**  
Buchhandlung Kunstgriff, Limmatstrasse 270, between Limmatplatz and Escher-Wyss-Platz  
 [http://www.kunstgriff.ch/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.kunstgriff.ch/ "http://www.kunstgriff.ch/")

Sphères (combination bookstore and bar/café), Hardturmstrasse 66, west of Escher-Wyss-Platz  
 [http://www.spheres.cc/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/www.spheres.cc/ "http://www.spheres.cc/")

Buchhandlung sec52, Josefstrasse 52, between train station and Limmatplatz  
 [http://sec52.ch/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804173631/http:/sec52.ch/ "http://sec52.ch/")
